of enzyme and virus synthesis". He and FranÃ§ois
Jacob showed that the living cell controls its manufacture of proteins through a
feedback mechanism analogous to a thermostat. Born in
Paris, he was also awarded several other honours and distinctions, among them
the LÃ©gion d'honneur. Monod (along with FranÃ§ois Jacob) is famous for his work
on the Lac operon. Study of the control of expression of genes in the Lac operon
provided the first example of a transcriptional regulation system. He also
suggested the existence of mRNA molecules that link the information encoded in
DNA and proteins. Monod is widely regarded as one of the founders of molecular
biology.
